quoteText: Reid Hoffman, founder of LinkedIn, observed that an entrepreneur is someone who will jump off a cliff and assemble an airplane on the way down.
bookTitle: Mastering the VC Game: A Venture Capital Insider Reveals How to Get from Start-up to IPO on Your Terms

quoteText: The most successful start-ups operate like good ensembles.
bookTitle: Mastering the VC Game: A Venture Capital Insider Reveals How to Get from Start-up to IPO on Your Terms

quoteText: Money is nice, right?,” he confessed to me. “Money gives you good things, it gives you a power that you can go do other things with. But it’s not a meaning of a life in itself. Money is a motivator, but it’s not the motivator that I wake up in the morning thinking about, it’s not the motivator that I go home thinking about, it’s not the motivator that gets you an obituary.
bookTitle: Mastering the VC Game: A Venture Capital Insider Reveals How to Get from Start-up to IPO on Your Terms

quoteText: And so here’s the VC conundrum: whether to focus on early-stage investments, where the risks are higher, the potential returns larger, but the fund size—and thus fee income—is smaller, or on later-stage deals where the risks are lower, the fees fatter, but the opportunities for tenfold returns are much rarer.
bookTitle: Mastering the VC Game: A Venture Capital Insider Reveals How to Get from Start-up to IPO on Your Terms

quoteText: If you’re going to fail, fail quick and cheap.’ There’s no stigma in failing that way.
bookTitle: Mastering the VC Game: A Venture Capital Insider Reveals How to Get from Start-up to IPO on Your Terms
